sentence.Network_en: In 1980 she had a brainwave that changed her life.
sentence.Network_cn: 1980年，她的一次突发奇想改变了她的生活。
我灵机一动，想出了个主意来！

sentence.Network_en: She had a brainwave and found a good solution.
sentence.Network_cn: 她灵机一动,想出了个好办法.

list.abs: He wanted to go beyond the psychic 8 Hz brainwave psi phenomena ., 他想超越心灵上 8 赫兹脑波诱发超心理学现象.
At certain brainwave frequencies , a sense of ego boundary vanishes ., 在某脑波频率上 , 利己自我感边界消失.
There are four categories of these brainwaves ., 这些脑波有四个种类.
...昏迷的濒死心脏病患的脑部活动，注射镇静剂的目的，在于让这些病危者可以止痛，但发现他们已经没有血压时，脑电波的活动却突然增加(brainwave surge)，历时30秒到3分钟不等，就有如完全清醒一样[http://eradoespirito.blogsp.

entry.tran: 突然想到的好主意；灵感
entry.def: If you have a brainwave, you suddenly have a clever idea.

example.ex: In 1980 she had a brainwave that changed her life.
example.tran: 1980年，她的一次突发奇想改变了她的生活。

entry.def: Brainwaves are electrical signals produced by the brain which can be recorded and measured.

example.tran: 对他的脑电波进行了连续监测。

means.word_mean: 1. (neurophysiology) rapid fluctuations of voltage between parts of the cerebral cortex that are detectable with an electroencephalograph
2. the clear (and often sudden) understanding of a complex situation

auth_sentence.content: Then someone in the arts world had a brainwave.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then someone in the arts world had a brainwave.

auth_sentence.content: So thank goodness for John Wisden's brainwave.

auth_sentence.content: Lawrence Booth, the latest Editor, calls it "probably the greatest brainwave in the history of Wisden".
